statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Dan Grunfeld scored 20 points, including eight in an 11-0 run to open the second half, and Stanford beat Brigham Young 62-53 Tuesday in the consolation bracket of the Maui Invitational.
article.headline: Grunfeld wins battle of GMs' sons
article.linkText: Run to open 2nd half lifts Stanford past BYU
article.story: LAHAINA, Hawaii (AP) -- Dan Grunfeld scored 20 points, including eight in an 11-0 run to open the second half, and Stanford beat Brigham Young 62-53 Tuesday in the consolation bracket of the Maui Invitational. The Cardinal (2-1) will play Louisville for fifth place on Wednesday. The Cardinals beat Chaminade 93-63 on Tuesday. Grunfeld, the son of Washington Wizards general manager Ernie Grunfeld, had two three-point plays in the run that started the second half and gave Stanford a 39-25 lead. BYU (0-2) failed to score on its first eight possessions of the second half, missing five shots and committing three turnovers. The Cougars, who lost 86-50 to North Carolina (No. 12 ESPN/USA Today, No. 11 AP) in the opening round, struggled with their shooting all game, finishing at 35.4 percent (17-for-48), and turned the ball over 19 times. Stanford, which lost 69-57 to Tennessee in the first round, didn't shoot well either, going 21-for-55 (38.2 percent), but the one big run was enough to hold off the Cougars. Jared Jensen had 11 points for BYU, which used a 9-2 run to get within 58-50 with 53 seconds left. Grunfeld wasn't the only son of an NBA general manager in the game. Austin Ainge, the son of BYU's all-time leading scorer and current Boston Celtics GM Danny Ainge, didn't score and had four turnovers in 12 minutes for the Cougars.
